Articles.Content:
Hi,

  • KSP Version :
  • 0.1.0.0.20892
  • Operating System and version :
  • Windows 10 Pro
  • CPU and GPU models, any other system information which could be relevant :
  • I7 8700K, RTX 3070, 32Go RAM DDR4
  • Description of the bug.  
  • I lost my trajectories reloading a quicksave around Minmus.
    • Expected Behavior
    • The trajectorie in map view appears
    • Observed Behavior
    • The trajectorie in map view disappears
  • Steps to Replicate
  • I don't know, I think the problem appears when reloading save.
  • Fixes / Workarounds (if known..)
  • I don't know
  • A list of ALL mods.  If the list is long, please consider using a spoiler window.
  • No mods
  • Other Notes / Screenshots / Log Files (if possible..)

I had to come back to kerbin without (Not easy but successful)

 

Edited February 26, 2023 by Niko_Dragovich
Same here, lot of times. Is a ramdom bug.

I've got this rocket that very reliably loses Trajectories  (at least the last 4 times I have launched that craft) my trajectory was gone the moment I staged twice to get rid of all the bosters - it was an asparagus setup.

Tracking Station reports the Spacecraft as Landed and I can recover it.

 

Interestingly I had it happen randomly to a different spacecraft after a Quick Load. Yet the trajectory reappeared after I touched down on Minmus and lifted off again.

I have yet to be able to get a trajectory to reappear once it disappears and the vessel status changes to “Landed” in the Tracking Station,. In each case, once the trajectory disappears, it’s gone for good for me. It almost always happens if I leave a vessel landed on a surface, then change focus to another vessel or the Tracking Station and come back. After I come back, status seems stuck on Landed no matter what. I don’t change focus, and launch again immediately after landing, trajectory displays work fine.
